text: it is that time of year there's tons of
summer fruit in the marketplace and you
might be wondering okay what's the best
way to store my summer fruits and also
how do I preserve them or the other
months ahead today I'm gonna show you
what you can do with a few different
summer fruits I have stone fruits in
front of me and I also have summer
berries now if you have stone fruits
like peaches cherries plums apricots
those are all stone fruits because they
have a giant pit in the center of them
if you have any stone fruits that are
not ripe like these peaches or apricots
or plums you can place them in a brown
paper bag and let them sit out at room
temperature you want to make sure that
you fold down the bag and what this does
is all of the gases that they admit over
time will help to ripen the fruit it
kind of seals them in the bag and it
helps ripen the fruit pot a faster rate
now stone fruit like cherries guess what
you shouldn't leave these out on the
counter these should go into the
refrigerator berries one of my favorite
summer fruits you want to make sure that
you store them in an even layer I think
a lot of people have trouble storing
berries they always get rotten or they
get smashed if when you get them home
from the farmers market or the
supermarket wherever you're buying them
and lay them out in a single layer on
top of paper towels this will help keep
the berries a little bit longer because
what you're not doing is you're not
compacting them or crushing them and
also if you have them layered up or
stacked up the accumulation of moisture
causes them to rot so leave them in a
nice even layer store them in the
refrigerator and I like to take another
piece of paper towel and place it over
top you can ever so slightly dampen this
but you don't want excess moisture
that's going to make them rot so with
stone fruit like apricots and peaches
you want to cut them into wedges or cut
them into slices and then freeze these
on a parchment-lined sheet tray like
this in an even layer you don't really
want them touching too much you're going
to throw them in the freezer until
they're nice and firm
then you can store them in one of these
resealable bags now you can do the same
thing with berries as well again scatter
them in an even layer if you're gonna do
strawberries you want to cut them up you
can either hold them or just remove the
tops and you can slice the berries you
can either quarter them the same thing
with cherries you can pit them and
freeze them whole just make sure that
the pits removed and all this stuff goes
right into the freezer again until it's
nice and firm and what this will do it
will ensure that they don't freeze
together in one giant block that's
always the worst thing right where you
take such great fruit and you want to
save it for the long term and you throw
it into one of these resealable bags and
it freezes into one big block well
laying them out on trays like this
really does help so here are some
berries that I've frozen in advance now
once they're nice and firm transfer them
to a bag label it put it into your
freezer and these will be ready for you
whenever you want to make your fruit
smoothies if you wanted to make a
wonderful strawberry pie or raspberry
pie peach pie so there you go guys a few
tips and tricks to preserving and
keeping your summer fruit as long as you
need it now if you have any seasonal
conundrums write in the comment section
below or reach out to me using the
hashtag kitchen conundrums have a good
summer guys
you
